data.name: Name for this hub

data_description.entity_id: Used as a prefix for sensors created by this integration (e.g., sensor.<prefix>_power).

hub_grid.title: Grid Configuration
hub_grid.description: Configure your grid and electrical settings

data.phase_a_current_entity_id: Sensor that measures grid current for phase A (required)
data.phase_b_current_entity_id: Sensor for phase B current (optional - set to 'None' for single-phase)
data.phase_c_current_entity_id: Sensor for phase C current (optional - set to 'None' for single/two-phase)
data.enable_max_import_power: Create max import power limit slider
data.max_import_power_entity_id: Sensor for maximum import power (optional override)

data_description.main_breaker_rating: The amperage rating printed on your main circuit breaker. Used to calculate maximum safe power draw per phase.
data_description.invert_phases: Enable if your CT clamp reads negative values when importing power from the grid. Common with some Shelly and Eastron meters.
data_description.enable_max_import_power: When enabled, creates a slider to limit total import power (default = breaker x phases x voltage). Uncheck to disable the limit entirely.
data_description.max_import_power_entity_id: Advanced — use a template sensor or input_number instead of the built-in slider. When set, takes precedence over the slider.
data_description.phase_voltage: Typically 230V in Europe, 120V in North America.
data_description.excess_export_threshold: In Excess mode, EV charging only starts when grid export exceeds this value. Set to your desired minimum export before charging begins.
data_description.site_update_frequency: How often grid sensor values are read. Does not affect how often charging commands are sent to chargers.

hub_inverter.title: Inverter Configuration
hub_inverter.description:
Configure inverter power limits and per-phase output sensors (optional — set power to 0 to leave unconstrained)

Battery max discharge power: {battery_power_hint}

data.inverter_output_phase_a_entity_id: Inverter output sensor for phase A (optional)
data.inverter_output_phase_b_entity_id: Inverter output sensor for phase B (optional)
data.inverter_output_phase_c_entity_id: Inverter output sensor for phase C (optional)

data_description.inverter_max_power: Nameplate rated power from your inverter's datasheet. Set to 0 to skip inverter limits entirely.
data_description.inverter_max_power_per_phase: Usually total power divided by the number of phases. Set to 0 to skip per-phase inverter limits.
data_description.inverter_supports_asymmetric: Most hybrid inverters (Deye, Victron, Huawei) support asymmetric output. SolarEdge and Fronius are typically symmetric.
data_description.wiring_topology: Parallel: inverter and grid feed independently (AC-coupled solar, no battery). Series: all power flows through the inverter (hybrid inverter with DC-coupled battery).

hub_battery.title: Battery & Solar Configuration
hub_battery.description: Configure home battery and solar production settings (optional)

data_description.solar_production_entity_id: Optional — if left empty, solar production is calculated from grid export + household consumption. Only set this if your inverter provides a direct solar power reading.
data_description.battery_power_entity_id: Positive values = battery discharging, negative values = battery charging.
data_description.battery_max_charge_power: Maximum power the inverter uses to charge the battery. Check your inverter specs or battery app.
data_description.battery_max_discharge_power: Maximum power the inverter can discharge from the battery. Check your inverter specs or battery app.
data_description.battery_soc_hysteresis: Prevents rapid on/off switching near SOC thresholds. E.g., with 3% hysteresis and a 90% target, charging resumes at 87% and pauses at 90%.

data.name: Name for this device
data.plug_switch_entity_id: Switch entity that controls the plug on/off

data_description.entity_id: Used as a prefix for sensors created by this integration (e.g., sensor.<prefix>_power).
data_description.plug_power_rating: The power this device draws when turned on. Used for allocation calculations. Ignored when a power monitor sensor is configured.
data_description.connected_to_phase: Which electrical phase(s) this plug is wired to. Determines which phase capacity is used in calculations.
data_description.charger_priority: Lower number = higher priority. Only affects distribution in Priority and Sequential modes.
data_description.plug_power_monitor_entity_id: When set, the actual measured power is used instead of the fixed power rating for more accurate allocation.
data_description.update_frequency: How often to re-evaluate whether this plug should be turned on or off.

charger_info.title: Charger Info

data_description.entity_id: Used as a prefix for sensors created by this integration (e.g., sensor.<prefix>_power).
data_description.charger_priority: Lower number = higher priority. Only affects distribution in Priority and Sequential modes.

charger_current.title: Current & Phase Mapping
charger_current.description: Configure current limits and how the charger's L1/L2/L3 terminals map to your site's electrical phases

data_description.evse_minimum_charge_current: The lowest current your charger supports. Check your charger's manual — most chargers support 6A.
data_description.evse_maximum_charge_current: The highest current your charger supports. Check your charger's manual.
data_description.charger_l1_phase: Only change if your charger is wired differently and/or you see unexpected behaviour regarding per-phase power limits.
data_description.charger_l2_phase: Only change if your charger is wired differently and/or you see unexpected behaviour regarding per-phase power limits.
data_description.charger_l3_phase: Only change if your charger is wired differently and/or you see unexpected behaviour regarding per-phase power limits.

charger_timing.title: Units & Timing
charger_timing.description: Configure charge rate unit and timing settings

data_description.charge_rate_unit: Most OCPP chargers use Amperes. Some chargers (e.g., certain Wallbox models) require Watts instead.
data_description.profile_validity_mode: Absolute uses timestamps, Relative uses durations. Try Absolute first — switch to Relative if your charger doesn't respond correctly.
data_description.update_frequency: How often to send updated charging profiles to this charger.
data_description.ocpp_profile_timeout: How long a charging profile remains valid. The charger reverts to default behavior if no new profile is sent within this time.
data_description.charge_pause_duration: When allocated current drops below the minimum, the charger is held at 0A for this duration before recalculating. Prevents rapid start/stop cycling.
data_description.stack_level: OCPP protocol parameter. Only change if your charger ignores charging profiles at the default level.
